result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J. Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin J. Washington is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin J. Washington was found guilty of Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**COMMENCE FORTHWITH**
Consecutive to any other time serving.
Credit to be determined by DOC - any objection to credit days shall be filed within 60 days and a hearing will be scheduled.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
**  Pay supervision fees.
  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program or Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
**  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.
  May not have contact with victims, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin J. Washington

records.addlTxt: Court reporter transcript invoice for 8/25/22 sentencing paid by county $ 115.50 for files 20cf1220 20cf1223 20cf1259 20cf1284 20cf1298 20cf1311 22cf518 22cf519

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Solis.   Clerk HMcBride.   State is compliant with victim rights notification.  PSI received - no objections.  Ct 1 - court imposes 4 years WSP - 2 years IC and 2 years ES with conditions - consecutive to any other time serving; DE not eligible for CIP or SAP;   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.  Credit to be determined by DOC - any objection to credit days shall be filed within 60 days and a hearing will be scheduled.   Appeal Rights, Federal Firearms Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.  Restitution to be determined by CC Iverson. RSH 10/14 11am.

03:10 PM   Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State. Defendant, Kevin J. Washington, appeared in custody with Attorney Xavier Solis.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 20CF1220/20CF1223/20CF1259/20CF1284/20CF1298/20CF1311/20CM1162/21CF1305/22CF518/22CF519/20CF963. Victim rights compliance. Defendant addresses the Court regarding his most recent letter filed. Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On the motion of the State, counts 2-5 are dismissed. The State is requesting a PSI. Attorney Solis is requesting to waive the PSI and proceed with sentencing today. Presentence Investigation ordered. JSH and JT for this matter are removed from the court's calendar. Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Solis.   Clerk HMcBride.  Re: DE's letter request to resolve cases.  State will put together an offer.  PLEAH 6/27 3pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Solis.   Clerk HMcBride.   Competency raised in 22CF519 and 22CF518.  Neither the State nor DE/Atty Solis contest the findings of the comp report.   Court finds DE competent to stand trial on 22CF518 and 22CF519.   DE waives preliminary hearing in files 22CF518 and 22CF519; probable cause found. Bound over or trial.  Information to be filed; reading waived.  Not guilty pleas entered for both files.   Updates for trial given to court.   Atty Solis plans to file a motion to contest video tapes by 6/3/22 - granted.  Once filed, hearing will be scheduled prior to trial date.  If need for Miranda Goodchild hearing - deadline to file also extended to 6/3/22.   Trial dates remain as calendared.   Bond continued.  All cross-referenced cases trail.

Comp Exam Order, Complaint and prior Comp Exams from cases 20CF963, 20CF1220, 20CF1223, 20CF1284 sent to WISCS and DHS.
CR-205 sent to KCJ

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Justin H - except for incidental in jail.

01:43 PM    Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Competency hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.  $5000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Atty raises issue of competency - Court orders exam.  ts
